website_summaries.verdict: This “bible” of mushrooms is detailed and well researched – good for beginners to experts.
pros: The most comprehensive choice with information on over 2,000 species
Great for advanced mushroom seekers who want more technical details
Includes humor for a more enjoyable reading experience
cons: Probably too bulky for taking with you when mushroom hunting
Black and white images not as helpful as color photos

customer_reviews.title: This book is huge!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the size of this book. It is over 2 in thick. It has a section in the middle a full color photos.it also has black and white photos throughout the description portion of the book. The book also has 70 distinctive mushrooms in a quick reference check list along with a key to the major groups of fleshy fungi.
customer_reviews.author: phydeaux

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably comprehensive.
customer_reviews.text: An amazing book - I can't fathom the breadth and depth of the author's knowledge. Be warned, however, that this kind of comprehensiveness comes at a price. The fact that it contains so many different mushrooms from all over the US makes it more difficult for a beginner to identify the common ones in my area. For many beginners, a more local guide to just the more common shrooms might make more sense (AND be more portable - this thing is huge). For the serious mushroom hunter though, this is the bible.
customer_reviews.author: BabbChuck

customer_reviews.title: Mostly B&W photos, primarily was a book focussed on California mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed to read the first sentence of the book mentioning that this was a book made originally for California mushrooms and then expanded to include others. Most people would expect that all photos will be color photos, however most photos are black and white with only the center section of the book with color photos (similar to decades old books) I'm sure that this book has pleased many purchasers with the vast amount if information on many varieties, but I view this as more of a scientific explanation of mushrooms rather than something of value to a beginner, which the description specifically mentions.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: All black and white pics. Not any color which would've helped in identifying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bible of Mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: I mean the title kind of sums it up. This book is a bit dated in nomenclature (since fungal taxonomy is changing at a rapid pace) but the descriptions are excellent and its the most comprehensive field guide with good keys for North America.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A classic... nothing else comes close
customer_reviews.text: The definitive thing you need to have if you're a mushroom lover. Maybe not in your backpack or hip pocket, but at basecamp for those rare gems that nothing else works. Exhaustive complete work, I thought I could get by without it owning it myself. Unless you're a mushroom savant, and memorized all of the obscurities and rarities, beyond the typical things you normally find you'll appreciate this! Such a classic, love the epic stories of mushroom culture and the hunt too. Might be a bit much to chew for neophytes, but is still accessible with room to grow into the hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great, but technical, resource
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to get used to, but I've successfully keyed out numerous mushrooms using it. Start with the internet nearby so you can look up pictures of the terms and mushrooms to double check. A facebook group is also helpful to double check your answers when starting off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be the mushroom bible.
customer_reviews.text: From the bit of research Ive done so far this seems to be a commonly referenced go to book. Its thick. I purchased a few others as well. Its a lot to take in but if you come at it systematically I believe it has al the answers you could need. Or at least demystifies some of it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in AK

customer_reviews.title: Thorough and comprehesive.
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly a definitive volume for anyone looking for something exhaustive, thorough and complete. The author is also very well educated on the subject and I own other books he has published. This is a solid choice for anyone looking for a serious text on the subject. It may very well be the best one Availableat present.
customer_reviews.author: Justaguy

customer_reviews.title: Quite a lot to digest
customer_reviews.text: As a novice forager, I was looking for a good book to learn from. This fits the bill. It is filled with many pictures, descriptions, and locations for a great many mushrooms. Also includes information on look alikes and cautions for wannabe foragers.
customer_reviews.author: Marta Jenssen

customer_reviews.title: Could Not Be Happier About This Book
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tome and I'm thrilled to discover the wealth of knowledge within it. I have derived great enjoyment from Arora's field guide over the past several years, and although I'm only several pages into Mushrooms Demystified, I can tell it's going to be a superbly rewarding read. I recommend this book to anyone interested in learning more about mushrooms and mycelia, especially in the Pacific Northwest. Beautiful colored section in the middle of the book with example photos, wish it were colored throughout.
customer_reviews.author: CanHazTrees

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reference book; great colorful photos showing each mushroom in their natural habitat
customer_reviews.text: Best reference book ever. This is our second one. Our first one is now for “field”; this one we will keep In our home library. Every year year we make Yule logs and fondant mushrooms and this book has great photos.
customer_reviews.author: DandyPatt

customer_reviews.title: A 'must have' for any serious mushroomer
customer_reviews.text: The numerous reviews on this book seem pretty accurate. I would merely add: Years ago, when I first purchased this book, I found it a bit overwhelming. Now, of all my mushroom books, (and I have quite a few) this is the one book that is nearly destroyed from heavy use. I can think of no better endorsement than mine's condition!
customer_reviews.author: E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I do really like this mushroom book - but beware it is HUGE ...
customer_reviews.text: I do really like this mushroom book - but beware it is HUGE and not light reading! Not really for taking out into the woods with you unless you are prepared to carry it. The only thing I wish it had was more in-color photos. Full of excellent information (and some humor, too!). Great reference guide for the person who REALLY wants to learn about mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Hoelz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful book for Mushroom enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this book to people that travel and explore local wilderness in new areas. It is semi-regional for the california-west coast of the US but contains many species found abroad. You can consider this book as the 'bible-of-mushroom-identification'. A regional book for your local area and this book together will cover 99% of your mushroom ID needs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Puyleart

customer_reviews.title: Great Mushroom Book
customer_reviews.text: Very good book for someone who already knows mushrooms a little. This book has far too many details but the details may save your life if you are not sure about a fungi. The best advice for a novice is read and then follow the beautiful rainstorms that make the mushrooms jump up like magic. Hunting fungi for pleasure or for money is great exercise and you can walk an area one day and find none then the next day come back and there be millions. 2013 spring had the best morels for WV since 1998. Wet years are good fungus yrs.
customer_reviews.author: George R Goode Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Large Book with Lots of Information!
customer_reviews.text: This is like the mushroom encyclopedia. This thing is so big, I could probably kill someone with it. This would not be a good book to bring with you in the field. This is a good book to leave at home. It is filled with so much information. The book is in black and white, and I do wish it was in color so that I can see the mushrooms more clearly. I live in the Pacific Northwest and this book is a good guide.
customer_reviews.author: Lola D

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: Great source of information and well written. It's a easy to understand book on mycology that even beginners can benefit from. Going into my library for sure.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: but I didn't find it as useful as I thought it could be
customer_reviews.text: This is meant more for the west coast, and I live in the mid atlantic region of the USA. The author is very knowledgeable, informative, and has a sense of humor, but I didn't find it as useful as I thought it could be. Also, the book is too bulky to be used as a field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatest mushroom book ever
customer_reviews.text: Love the book and how differentiated mushrooms can be identified. Greatest resource book
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste the $$$
customer_reviews.text: The images in the book are all black and white. Along with knowing the physical description, color is also vital. There are subtle differences between mushrooms in their color. Black and white photos lack detail and the subtle differences. Regret having wasted my money on this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Mushroom Hunter's Bible
customer_reviews.text: This book has everything you need to know to identify and learn about mushrooms in the Western United States (and much of the rest of the country). I would recommend first getting Aurora's, "All the Rain Promises and More... A Hip Pocket Guide to Western Mushrooms". This book works best as a "backup" or reference to "All the Rain Promises." It is so refreshing to see a solid, thoroughly researched scientific text that is at the same time fun, whimsical and down to earth. I do wish there were more color photos as is the case with "All the Rain Promises," but the book would be too thick to carry in one hand and 5x as expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift and it was well liked!
customer_reviews.text: This book was a real hit. My husband loved it and i helped begin a long study on mushrooms..
customer_reviews.author: Meg Swicegood

customer_reviews.title: The Mushroom Bible
customer_reviews.text: Highly cross-referenced in. Where that book is small enough to pocket, this book is a thousand-page behemoth of comprehensive mushroom information.
customer_reviews.author: drivec

customer_reviews.title: Mushrooms Demystified
customer_reviews.text: Even though the Author is from California this is an outstanding mushrooming and fungi book. Of all the massive reference and picture books this one definatly scores the highest. The ultimate book about mushrooming background information that should nudge you out of the kiddy pool into the deepend of study and classification. The greatest part of this book is you don't get mired up in language and text or sacrifice images for charts. It has it all and a sense of humor. Read this one, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Patterson Patrick

customer_reviews.title: and great to use on your mushrooming foray
customer_reviews.text: This is a most treasured shrooming book which I bought to replaced my very worn old copy. Very detailed, well written, and great to use on your mushrooming foray.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: The PNW mushroom Bible!!!
customer_reviews.text: Are you into mushrooms? You should already own this. An absolute staple for all west coast fungiphiles. Be forewarned, it is technical, but still very useful to the layperson.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: More information than most people can possibly use about mushrooms ...
customer_reviews.text: More information than most people can possibly use about mushrooms. Not many photos. Would be difficult to use without quite a bit of background knowledge on mushrooms and plenty of experience with dichotomous keys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of technical, more black and white images not helpful for this beginner. Heavy chunk of paper to carry in backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Grunt

customer_reviews.title: The classic, and a must have
customer_reviews.text: Very, very, very, VERY good book on identifying wild mushrooms. Also, a very, very, very, VERY funny and witty book! Has plenty of information pertaining to uses, preparations, relationships, dangers, and wonders of our fungi friends. Though it reads well as a guide, it's never boring, David always seems to have something to say to make it interesting. Get it, get it now. On a side note... my copy was actually signed by the man himself... HOW COOL IS THAT!?!? :D
customer_reviews.author: Polski

customer_reviews.title: Best book I’ve found yet
customer_reviews.text: This book was a lot longer than I thought. I really love it. Very detailed and well laid out. I would definitely recommend. A lot of good information!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: An Essential Textbook
customer_reviews.text: I've been collecting wild mushrooms here in Washington state for 40 years and was pleased to find a book so well organized and helpful. I can't wait until this Spring to start picking the usuals for around here but armed with Mushrooms Demystified I might expand just a bit, especially with the Boletes. If you need a book to fall back on for those species you've been eyeing for years, this is the ticket, however you will need to keep it in your vehicle due to the book's size and you might want to use some clear mailing tape on the book's cover for additional protection if you plan on using it outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard R. Nicol

customer_reviews.title: THE ONE.
customer_reviews.text: This is the book that really allowed me to dive into foraging with confidence. It gives such thorough descriptions of each specimen, and most importantly provides incredibly detailed but straightforward education on taking field notes. Anora is hilarious and brilliant, such a fun read. The only minor downside is that he is based in CA, and is missing some common east-coast varieties. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Best book for researching Mushrooms I ever had or could ...
customer_reviews.text: Best book for researching Mushrooms I ever had or could hope for. (Stolen since purchase from my home). I miss it very very very much. Excellent book in my opinion. Great purchase. As advertised, perfect transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Audio Theater

customer_reviews.title: More than enough info.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! 959 pages of more info than I was expecting! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Demystified indeed
customer_reviews.text: While it doesn't address fungi from the SE U.S. specifically, this book has a wealth of information that makes categorizing local fungi much easier. Good source for the weekend fungi photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Fly Guy

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book, it is the ultimate guide to mushrooms. It had nearly every mushroom that I was able to find in the Pacific Northwest.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Best mushroom ID book out there
customer_reviews.text: We call this the mushroom bible. Most comprehensive mushroom ID book we’ve found.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleB

customer_reviews.title: This covers everything,  but photos are b&w.
customer_reviews.text: This book is comprehensive, and goes further to help me understand how the keys work than any other. My only criticism is that all the identifying photos are black and white.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Komoroski

customer_reviews.title: A Little Over My Head.
customer_reviews.text: This book will surely come in handy as I become a better mushroom hunter, however, it is a little advanced and not what I expected (it was recommended in a mushroom class I took.) I was sorry there weren't more colored pictures, although the chart system is helpful. Again, I think this is a wonderful book for those more experienced in the field, but a little more than I need at this time.
customer_reviews.author: good2Bme

customer_reviews.title: So far It's very interesting and fun to read
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this book to be so thick! So far It's very interesting and fun to read. It's very informative for someone who is just learning the mysteries of fungi. Now I only wish I lived in California where the author intended this book to be used!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Lots of info
customer_reviews.text: Does not help me pinpoint mushrooms im finding in my area of central Texas I do recomend this Book it is a very good tool to add to your mushroom hunting library
customer_reviews.author: curtis ross

customer_reviews.title: Great Companion Book
customer_reviews.text: This hard to find book is great. Arora did a great job. The keys very good, are easy to use and the descriptions of each mushroom identified in the book are comprehensive and even entertaining. (A dicot' key can be a truly horrid thing.) The illustrations for key features also very helpful. Even for casual reading it is entertaining! The Fifth Kingdom is a great addition to this book for addl info about life cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Perpet Student

customer_reviews.title: All you'd ever want to know about mushrooms!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a complete collection of information - anything you'd ever hope to know about mushrooms. I got it to give as a gift and should have paid attention to the weight. It's a compact book, but in my opinion to big to carry along as a resource in the field. I was a little disappointed that the colored pictures were so limited. Otherwise, it appears to be a great resource.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: Astound Your Friends With Your Knowledge
customer_reviews.text: We bought this book after receiving the author's other book, All That The Rain Promises and More...This book expounds on the information therein contained. If you are going to go mushrooming in the United States (or elsewhere), you should have both books. This one is a little more scientific but has more information which you can use to identify edible (and poisonous!) mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: This book is really great. My husband uses it in New England and ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is really great. My husband uses it in New England and finds that it really is the Bible of mushroom identification.
customer_reviews.author: ABrooks

customer_reviews.title: Great information about Fungi!
customer_reviews.text: One of the all time best books for mushrooming knowledge and hunting! A true investment for wildcraft food harveters.
customer_reviews.author: Olson Co.

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: I'm using is as a resource in ID'ing mushrooms. Until I had this book I had only been able to ID a VERY few. Now, by patiently using the keys presented, I have been able to ID four more. Mycology is a tough hobby! I'd say thumbs up; for Mushrooms Demystified.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that others haven't. It's the mushroom bible.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great book, actually enjoyable to read as he tends to be quick witted with his terrific quips.
customer_reviews.author: David Harouff

customer_reviews.title: Shroom, shroom, shroom, shroom, shroom, shroom, shroom
customer_reviews.text: Best book ever! I love this book! Not as stuffy as some compendiums, excellent with descriptions and pictures. Valuable in identification! Mmmmm tasty chanterelles!
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect new condition!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book. I loaned out the first one I owned. Of course I forget where it went. And they probably forgot where they got it. Perfect new condition!
customer_reviews.author: darrell Foust

customer_reviews.title: So far I like this book
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this book. Tried reading it the other night in bed. The text font is small and it's heavy given that it's approx 3" thick. May not serve as the best field-guide, but is definitely a great reference.I like the approach the author has taken with his prose.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great resource and I like that its written with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great resource and I like that its written with a bit of humor as well as good science. The book is somewhat regionally focused on Central California which is great for me, maybe not comprehensive enough for others.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: A Mush Read!
customer_reviews.text: This guide is wonderful for Californians trying to identify native mushrooms. I use it in conjunction with the audoban society's field guide. I am sure it would work fine for other areas in America but i think it was made with central coast CA in mind. This is a pretty comprehensive guide as far as introductions to mushrooms goes.
customer_reviews.author: xbertolerox

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend this book enough
customer_reviews.text: Cannot recommend this book enough. I took a Mycology course at my university that required this, and wow, is this helpful. I felt prepared to identify shrooms, and David is a very amiable writer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really great book -- my son goes mushroom hunting often and has really enjoyed this helpful book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An experienced mushroom hunter recommended this book and I'm glad I purchased it
customer_reviews.text: Much larger book than I thought. Everything you ever wanted to know and then some. An experienced mushroom hunter recommended this book and I'm glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: DFR

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for my dad!
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Love the writing style and handy ruler on the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Steph Pitchford

customer_reviews.title: This one is my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I have several mushroom books. This one is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Extremely thorough, well researched with LOTS of information and color photographs. When I ordered this I had no idea huge this book is! Excellent quality paper and well done. This is my go to resource for all things mushroom!
customer_reviews.author: Woofie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the average dichotomous key
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the average dichotomous key, I bought this for a class but I'd recommend it for anyone who really wants to learn about mushrooms. It is always nice when textbooks for school are books that are useful outside of the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L.

customer_reviews.title: Great book. I highly recommend this if you are ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book. I highly recommend this if you are going to learn to forage for mushrooms. You will want to get another book for your particular area that has pictures, as this one has many great photos, but you will need more than one source to confirm identification.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to hunt mushrooms in California, this book is essential. With both this book AND the internet (and a lot of patience) you can pretty much identify anything you find (except of course for the LWMs -little white mushrooms). And considering the danger involved in eating wild mushrooms, you'd be crazy NOT to own this book.
customer_reviews.author: Tony V

customer_reviews.title: Very well done guide
customer_reviews.text: It may be a little detailed, but even a beginner needs to know the subtle differences between edible and non-edible/toxic species. I find this book to be a very thorough guide, with humor and personal anecdotes to keep it from reading like a scientific textbook.
customer_reviews.author: Trent M

customer_reviews.title: Mushroom book that is more for the western part of the U.S.
customer_reviews.text: Good book to ad to your collection if you have a deep interest in multitudes of mushrooms. Only thing I didn't like was the black-and-white pictures. And that some of the mushrooms don't have pictures. Still lots of information that will help in identification.
customer_reviews.author: james wright

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am a novies mushroom growing and this book helps me really understand mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: This book offered some help
customer_reviews.text: This book helped us identify several prized mushrooms that grow wild here. We could have used even more pictures in general to better identify others that we couldn't be totally sure of being what was described.
customer_reviews.author: Eagledragon

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Not for the field unless you are not hiking far or very dedicated. The content is great and very informative.
customer_reviews.author: PickUp

customer_reviews.title: ... it so I am still mystified the book is good at explaining details
customer_reviews.text: still reading it so I am still mystified the book is good at explaining details. Trouble is it is winter now so I will have mushroom hunt later.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbluefrog

customer_reviews.title: Shroons Demystified
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reference book...but not a field guide. Probably too heavy to drag around the forest on a foray.
customer_reviews.author: David K Story

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor Myteries are my interest
customer_reviews.text: Like to have alternative resources to compare information. After reading the reviews (Thanks, Folks!) I added this book to my collection of idenifying mushrooms. Never can have too many resources when it comes to mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Shegun

customer_reviews.title: If this is the bible, who is Arora?
customer_reviews.text: As a beginning student of the wily mushroom, I saw this book at the elbow of almost every experienced hunter - even professors of mycology! Clearly a must-have. My use of the book is a work in progress, but the author's humor and fine general advice about mushrooming have already transformed my efforts from clueless bumbling to intermediate bumbling. I am actually making identifications of the more common prey. At least for me, this is a book to grow into - just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. West

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have book for any serious mycophile's ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have book for any serious mycophile's library of reference. Until I knew what I was doing I would have a few cross references.
customer_reviews.author: SmokingChicken

customer_reviews.title: but lacking on Good Id
customer_reviews.text: Lots of Information in this book, but lacking on Good Id photos
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and in great condition!
customer_reviews.text: I received the item very quickly (3 days), and the product was exactly as described and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Streit

customer_reviews.title: Demystified indeed.
customer_reviews.text: Mushrooms Demystified is an excellent work on macromycetes, i.e. mushroom fungi. Written in a very accessible language, the book fulfills it's purpose of teaching the basics of mushroom identification and presenting the reader with valuable information on edibility, toxicity, geographic location and tips for identification. No other resource gathers as much information in the same place as this book. Whether you're an amateur collector or a professional, or if your trip is exclusively purposed on finding mushrooms, this book is a must when you're out camping.
customer_reviews.author: Efrenjo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book, although would be even better if pix were all color!
customer_reviews.author: Pam S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice, thorough book. Definitely not pocket size! But much more informative.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer#1

customer_reviews.title: Has been and still is the best book on identifying almost every mushroom you'll ever find
customer_reviews.text: Has been and still is the best book on identifying almost every mushroom you'll ever find. Requires a little background knowledge, but not overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: anderld47

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Had this book for about a year now. Have discovered 5 different edible species of mushroom just in my yard. Many, many others out in the forest. Great field guide! Hasn't wronged me yet!
customer_reviews.author: shane-o

customer_reviews.title: The best book alive
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this book I knew next to nothing about mushroom identification. Now, with the help of it, I can ID hundreds of fungi. This book is well written, concise, extremely informative and other than binomial nomenclature changing, very accurate. This is hands down THE best book on mushrooms in our region. Some consider it the mushroom bible, I certainly do.
customer_reviews.author: zachary hardin

customer_reviews.title: It can be difficult identifying mushrooms but this guide has ...
customer_reviews.text: It can be difficult identifying mushrooms but this guide has detailed keys that can typically get you to the correct genus, if not species. I only wish there were more color images!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was necessary for my mycology class, but it was surprisingly helpful and interesting! It helped me pass the class and I actually still use it because it sparked my interest on the subject! It's my go to guide for mushroom hunting!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Kistler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great book for the money, my boyfriend loves it (:
customer_reviews.author: Live Wild LLC

customer_reviews.title: Serious mushroom hunter's must have!
customer_reviews.text: A classic guide with extensive keys. Covers a large number of species. Mostly black and white photos but great information. The keys are the heart of this book.
customer_reviews.author: P. Green

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting book. Offers a lot of information to identify those mushrooms lurking in your backyard
customer_reviews.author: terri thompson

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive, but doesn't address magic mushrooms.
customer_reviews.text: This book is chock full of information about one of my biggest fascinations - mushrooms! It contains pretty much everything anyone would want to know about them in a well organized way. The only thing I'm disappointed about is that it doesn't have anything about psychedelic mushrooms. In fact, it has somewhat of a judgmental explanation of why it's purposely not in the book. I am not a druggie by any definition, but magic mushrooms are just a fascinating aspect of the magic of mushrooms in general, so it'd be interesting to learn about it.
customer_reviews.author: PennZenn

customer_reviews.title: why do i need to write a title?
customer_reviews.text: THE comprehensive guide to mushrooms. I own several that I like, and this is probably the best of them. It's large size makes it unsuitable for a field guide, but it's a great resource. Just get "All that the rain promises...," or the Audubon book for a field guide.
customer_reviews.author: benny builds banyas

customer_reviews.title: Textbook quality information and keys, written with a sense ...
customer_reviews.text: Textbook quality information and keys, written with a sense of humor that makes going through the book a bit less intimidating.
customer_reviews.author: Lee H.

customer_reviews.title: Best shroom book EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book many years ago and used it faithfully until I got a job in the Chicago area and sold it in an auction. I've recently re-bought it after owning several other fungi references and decided that I will never be without it again. All around best reference!
customer_reviews.author: skyskifoxman

customer_reviews.title: He asked for this book and said it was the best.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas. He asked for this book and said it was the best.
customer_reviews.author: Christie L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful set of books
customer_reviews.text: Companion book to All That the Rain Promises and More. Wonderful set of books!
customer_reviews.author: Jeepgadget

customer_reviews.title: Shrooms
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book to have in any collection. Whether it's birds or mushrooms or butterflies, the more reference books the better!
customer_reviews.author: ecopeland

customer_reviews.title: For the mushroom fanatic!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ultimate mushroom book. It isn't in color so if you depend on color photos to I.D. mushroom, forget it, but the science is all there. It is too heavy to carry on a foray but it is good to have at the end of the day for identification.
customer_reviews.author: Cheney

customer_reviews.title: easy to understand for a new and old mushroom forager
customer_reviews.text: with pictures and instructions you shouldn't make any mistakes the book is very simple and complete
customer_reviews.author: rich bonfiglio

customer_reviews.title: It's a fantastic book with a wide
customer_reviews.text: It's a fantastic book with a wide, objective variety of mushrooms to read about. More color photos would be fantastic, and I also wish the author had included more information on the habitats
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great resource for anything i have needed to know about mushrooms. Fantastic book.
customer_reviews.author: lucindalou

customer_reviews.title: Been using it for a year now great reference
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a year now great reference for identification helps to explain and understand that this is a very complex subject. No book will ever replace experience but this is a great start. Very informative but not an easy read.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: the mushroom bible!
customer_reviews.text: So much information in this book!! I admit I would have liked to see a few more color pictures, but there is such a wealth of knowledge in this book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
